intro: Calea scabra var. longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf calea, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are often elongated and may have a waxy surface, while its flowers are arranged in clusters. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
